pr.title: Why hire me?
pr.author: 0ce10tsgit
pr.subtitle: wants you to merge his skills into your team

paragraphs: I can build and ship real backend APIs end-to-end.

For RideLink (a ride-sharing app) I implemented POST and GET endpoints for rides using FastAPI with full Pydantic model validation. I set up the database connection via environment variables so switching between Supabase and a Neon testing instance was just one line in the .env file. Tested all endpoints, confirmed both compile and runtime correctness, and cleaned up leftover scaffolding code along the way.
I don't just write code that runs — I write code that's easy to hand off.

commits.message: Post and get/ Pydantic Models/ ENV db stuff

paragraphs: I debug systematically and don't give up when the obvious path breaks.

Supabase was giving me trouble during testing, so instead of blocking the team I spun up a temporary Postgres instance on Neon, tested all the endpoints there, and confirmed everything worked. Switching back is a one-line change in .env — I built it that way on purpose.
double checked and tested and it now compiles and works fine ✓

commits.message: ENV error handler + Neon DB validation

paragraphs: I build things for fun, not just for class.

This website (ganguli.dev) is a personal project — a live portfolio that shows your real IP-based location on a dark Carto map using the Leaflet.js API and a custom PHP backend. I built the map view, the dining menu utility for RPI, and now this pitch page. I'm comfortable across the stack: HTML/CSS/JS on the front, PHP/Python on the back, Postgres in the middle.
